title: Paracata
description: Paracata, also known as Başbulak and Bulakbaşı, is situated near Taşburun in the Kars province in eastern Turkey. Here a stone block with an inscription of the Urartean king Minua (9th / 8th century BCE) was found, in which he claims to have built the building to which the stone block belonged. Furthermore, Minua states that he has built a fortress at this place and given it the name "Minuahinili" (i.e. "The Minuan“).

properties.description: Representative point location digitized from the Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World by the Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations project at Harvard University.
properties.title: DARMC location 21479
